certifications.certification_name: AZ-204: Developing Solutions for Microsoft Azure

audience_profile.description: As a candidate for this exam, you’re responsible for participating in all phases of development, from requirements gathering to monitoring. You should have proficiency in various Azure aspects and work alongside various professionals.
audience_profile.experience_requirements: At least two years of professional development experience and experience with Azure.
other_skills: Able to program in an Azure-supported language.
Proficient using Azure CLI, Azure PowerShell, and other tools.

sub_skills: Implement containerized solutions: Create and manage container images, Publish an image to Azure Container Registry, Run containers using Azure Container Instance, Create solutions using Azure Container Apps
Implement Azure App Service Web Apps: Create an Azure App Service Web App, Enable diagnostics logging, Deploy code to a web app, Configure web app settings, Implement autoscaling
Implement Azure Functions: Create and configure an Azure Function App, Implement input and output bindings, Implement function triggers
Develop solutions using Azure Cosmos DB: Perform operations on containers and items, Set consistency level, Implement change feed notifications
Develop solutions using Azure Blob Storage: Set and retrieve properties and metadata, Perform operations using the SDK, Implement storage policies, Implement static site hosting

Implement user authentication and authorization: Authenticate and authorize users using Microsoft Identity, Authenticate and authorize users and apps using Microsoft Entra ID, Create shared access signatures, Interact with Microsoft Graph
Implement secure Azure solutions: Secure app configuration data, Develop code for Azure Key Vault, Implement Managed Identities

skills.skill_name: Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize Azure solutions
sub_skills: Implement caching: Configure Azure Cache for Redis, Implement application cache patterns, Implement Azure Content Delivery Network
Troubleshoot using Application Insights: Configure for Application Insights, Monitor and analyze metrics, Implement Application Insights web tests and alerts

skills.skill_name: Connect to and consume Azure and third-party services
sub_skills: Implement API Management: Create an API Management instance, Document APIs, Configure access to APIs, Implement API policies
Develop event-based solutions: Implement solutions using Azure Event Grid, Implement solutions using Azure Event Hub
Develop message-based solutions: Implement solutions using Azure Service Bus, Implement solutions using Azure Queue Storage queues

audience_profile.description: Candidates for this exam should have subject matter expertise in implementing, managing, and monitoring an organization’s Microsoft Azure environment, including virtual networks, storage, compute, identity, security, and governance.
audience_profile.experience_requirements: Familiarity with mentioned proficiency requirements and roles.

sub_skills: Manage Azure AD users and groups: Create users and groups, Manage user and group properties, Manage licenses in Azure AD, Manage external users, Configure SSPR
Manage access to Azure resources: Manage built-in Azure roles, Assign roles at different scopes, Interpret access assignments

Manage Azure subscriptions and governance: Implement and manage Azure Policy, Configure resource locks, Apply and manage tags on resources, Manage resource groups, Manage subscriptions, Manage costs using alerts and Azure Advisor, Configure management groups

Configure access to storage: Configure Azure Storage firewalls and VNETs, Create and use SAS tokens, Configure stored access policies, Manage access keys, Configure identity-based access for Azure Files

Configure and manage storage accounts: Create and configure storage accounts, Configure Azure Storage redundancy, Configure object replication, Configure storage account encryption, Manage data using Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy

Configure Azure Files and Azure Blob Storage: Create and configure a file share in Azure Storage, Create and configure a container in Blob Storage, Configure storage tiers, Configure snapshots and soft delete for Azure Files, Configure blob lifecycle management, Configure blob versioning

skills.skill_name: Deploy and manage Azure compute resources
sub_skills: Automate deployment of resources using ARM templates or Bicep files: Interpret, Modify, Deploy, Export a deployment as an ARM template or compile as a Bicep file
Create and configure virtual machines: Create a VM, Configure Azure Disk Encryption, Move VM, Manage VM sizes, Manage VM disks, Deploy VMs to availability zones and sets
Provision and manage containers: Create and manage Azure container registry, Provision containers using Azure Container Instances and Apps, Manage sizing and scaling for containers
Create and configure Azure App Service: Provision App Service plan, Configure scaling, Create App Service, Configure certificates, Map DNS, Configure backup, Networking settings, Deployment slots
Configure and manage virtual networks: Create and configure networks and subnets, Configure peering, Configure public IPs, Configure user-defined routes, Troubleshoot network connectivity
Configure secure access: Create and configure NSGs and application security groups, Evaluate NSG rules, Implement Azure Bastion, Configure service and private endpoints for Azure PaaS
Configure name resolution and load balancing: Configure Azure DNS, Configure load balancer, Troubleshoot load balancing

Monitor resources: Interpret metrics in Azure Monitor, Configure log settings, Query and analyze logs, Set up alert rules in Azure Monitor, Configure and interpret monitoring using Azure Monitor Insights, Use Network Watcher and Connection Monitor

Implement backup and recovery: Create Recovery Services and Backup vaults, Configure backup policies, Perform backup and restore operations, Configure Azure Site Recovery, Perform failover to a secondary region

audience_profile.description: Candidates for this exam are technology professionals who want to demonstrate foundational knowledge of cloud concepts in general and Azure in particular. They can describe Azure architectural components and Azure services, such as compute, networking, and storage. They also describe features and tools to secure, govern, and administer Azure.
proficiency_requirements: Skills in IT areas like infrastructure management, database management, or software development
audience_profile.experience_requirements: Skills and experience working with an area of IT, such as infrastructure management, database management, or software development.

sub_skills: Define cloud computing
Define cloud models
Identify use cases for cloud models
Describe the consumption-based model
Describe benefits of cloud services
Describe IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS
Describe Azure regions and datacenters
Describe resources and resource groups
Compare compute types
Describe virtual networking and DNS
Describe storage services and options
Describe Azure identity and security
Describe factors affecting costs in Azure
Describe cost management capabilities
Describe Azure governance and compliance tools
Describe Azure deployment and management tools
Describe monitoring tools in Azure
